text:
Fort Washington Park: A northeastward view from a point in same near West 178th Street, showing buildings on the opposite side of Riverside Drive, forming part of the Washington Heights colony. The turreted building seen is the residence of Dr. Chas. V. Paterno. Latter views, from this vantage point, will have overhead the new George Washington Bridge.

P. L. Sperr.

2) Looking south in Fort Washington Park from the George Washington Bridge and showing the West Side Express Highway. On the left is the Columbia Medical Center.

P.L.Sperr

May 27, 1927.

August 21, 1939.

Fort Washington Park: A northeastward view from a point in same near West 178th Street, showing buildings on the opposite side of Riverside Drive, forming part of the Washington Heights colony. The turreted building seen is the residence of Dr. Chas. V. Paterno. Latter views, from this vantage point, will have overhead the new George Washington Bridge.

P. L. Sperr.

2) Looking south in Fort Washington Park from the George Washington Bridge and showing the West Side Express Highway. On the left is the Columbia Medical Center.

P.L.Sperr

May 27, 1927.

August 21, 1939.

186-196 Pinehurst Ave., west side, south of West 187th Street, showing a 6-story apartment house, newly constructed.

About 1928.

Albert Rothschild.

Northern Avenue, west 187th Street, (northern Avenue changed to Cabrini Blvd, since 1938.) showing the site of P.S. 187.

Board of Education, N.Y.C.
 June 17, 1930.
